Technology Robotix Society shared Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur's post. India’s policy think tank NITI Aayog (see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NITI_Aayog andhttp://www.niti.gov.in/) is organizing MoveHack 2018, a global mobility hackathon to crowdsource solutions aimed at the future of mobility in India. Envisaged to be one of the largest hackathons globally, MoveHack is focused on 10 themes and structured over three legs: online, followed by Singapore leg, and the finals in New Delhi. MoveHack aims to bring about innovative, dynamic and scalable solutions to problems pertaining to mobility. The hackathon has a two-pronged campaign approach: (a) “Just Code It”: aimed at solutions through innovations in technology/product/software and data analysis, and (b) “Just Solve It”: innovative business ideas or sustainable solutions to transform mobility infrastructure through technology. Move Hack is open to individuals of all nationalities, making it a truly global hackathon. Registrations are open at https://www.movehack.gov.in. The top 30 teams from the online submissions will travel to Delhi to participate in the Final Round to be held in New Delhi on 5 and 6 Sep 2018. The winners will be announced during the Move Summit 2018, which is also organized by NITI Aayog on 7 and 8 Sep 2018 in New Delhi (http://movesummit.in/) and is being inaugurated by the Hon’ble Prime Minister of India. Awards for the hackathon include recognizing top 10 winners, with a total prize of more than Rs. 2 crores.

#Robotics, Autonomous Vehicles and Deep Learning conference 2018 which is going to be organized during September 10-11, 2018 in Singapore. Our Organization is very much delighted to invite you and  your Lab or department. Smart Robotic Conference 2018 is offering a wide range of benefits to promote and expose your research and services to the large number of audience and also if you want you can collaborate with us.

As the hardest problems of technology can only be solved by the open collaboration of world-wide scientific community. In order to make conference successful, participation from great organization like yours is very much required and we are expecting a large number of participants from your side for our conference.

For event details please log into: http://robotics.conferenceseries.com/

By collaborating with us you can avail the following benefits:
•         Display of logos on all event paraphernalia and areas around the event space as required.
•         Access to our attendees & delegates
•         Collaborators will get 25% discount on Conference registrations. 
•         Special Group discount to your members to attend the Smart Robotic Congress 2018
•         Opportunity to organize a workshop at any one of our events.
•         Registered Organizations logo will be displayed in the respective conference and supporting journal webpage with a statement "supported by"
•         Registered Organization for exhibition can organize a small symposium/exhibit a stall with complimentary registration pass at the event
•        You may avail one Free Conference pass for the board of director/ higher management from associated organization.

Events in smart robotics congress 2018:
•         Speaker slots for keynote talk and plenary talk for doctorates, professors, post-doctoral fellows and young research forum.
•        Workshops/Symposium platform for Doctorates and Professors.
•        Exhibitor booths for Robot Industries.
•       Poster presentation for students.

Thanks and Regards
Sincerely
Jack kallis
Conference Manager
Smart Robotics Congress 2018
47 Churchfield Road, London, W3 6AY, UK
Toll Free: USA: 1 (800) 216 6499 | UK: 44-800-098-8455 | Tokyo:  81-345780247

“However difficult life may seem, there is always something you can do and succeed at. All what matters is just that you don’t give up.”
Stephen Hawking

A living embodiment of countless extraordinary traits. The Genius of the twenty first century, left us today. Dedicating his whole life to answering the biggest question humankind could impose on itself - “Where did it all begin?” and putting together the greatest theory of all times in the field - “The Big Bang theory”, he effortlessly outsmarted us all. Without a hint of pride, he made groundbreaking progress in the fields of his work. He gave us - The Brief History of Time and was most probably working on some super-intelligent theory to reveal many secrets when he finally departed to find the eternal truth behind it all.
May his soul rest in peace.

He gave us - The Brief History of Time and was most probably working on some super-intelligent theory to reveal many secrets when he finally departed to find the eternal truth behind it all.
May his soul rest in peace.

“However difficult life may seem, there is always something you can do and succeed at. All what matters is just that you don’t give up.”
Stephan Hawkins

A living embodiment of countless extraordinary traits. The Genius of the twenty first century, left us today. Dedicating his whole life to answering the biggest question humankind could impose on itself - “Where did it all begin?” and putting together the greatest theory of all times in the field - “The Big Bang theory”, he effortlessly outsmarted us all. Without a hint of pride, he made groundbreaking progress in the fields of his work. He gave us - The Brief History of Time and was most probably working on some super-intelligent theory to reveal many secrets when he finally departed to find the eternal truth behind it all.
May his soul rest in peace.

A robot that is capable of changing it's interaxial distance to traverse ground that diverges, converges and turns. Sounds exciting, doesn't it? And now we present an event that provides a platform to do just that. 
To make your job easier, we've made tutorials and DIYs which will give you a head start. So dive right in.

This is the Group division of the Phase-2 workshop. Please reach the given venue by 2pm on December 9th, 2017. 
Autonomous Group-1: F244, Main building
Autonomous Group-2: F236, Main building
IP: F235, Main building.

All the people attending the IP workshop try to dual boot your laptops with Ubuntu 16.04 before coming to save essential time and efforts.

message:
After a memorable two and half days, Robotix 2017 was successfully concluded. Technology Robotix Society thanks all participants for their enthusiasm which was vital to make the fest such a huge event.

A special congratulation to all the winners of the three events : 

Bomb Disposal:
1st Prize: Vishwadeep Paul, Abdul Ali Adil Khan (CSIT, Durg)
2nd Prize: Sonu Gupta, Sidhant Gupta, Sourav Payra, Avishek Kumar Banka (Academy of Technology, West Bengal)
3rd Prize: Aman Tripathi, Rajat Kumar (Institute of Engineering and Rural Technology, Allahabad)
Best Freshers: Utkarsh Sharma, Mihir Sampat, Raj Tulshan, Divesh Goyal (IIT Kharagpur)
Best Mech Design: Raj Agarwal, Shreshth Tuli, Abhinav Kalra (IIT Delhi)

B.R.I.C.K.S.:
1st Prize: Naman Sharma, Balwant Singh Shekhawat, Abhishek Thamman, Rakshit Shukla (IIT BHU)
2nd Prize: Praveen Nyati, Ashwin Nehete, Shourya Kumar, Smriti Tiwari (IIT Kharagpur)
3rd Prize: Prabin Rath, Ateet Roy, Ankit Behera, Smruti Subudhi (NIT Rourkela)
Best Freshers: Palak Harwani, Harsh Maheshwari, Prerit Jain, Rohit Ner (IIT Kharagpur)
Best Embedded Design: Prince Agarwal, Abhinav Trivedi, Vishal Rana (NIT Patna)

Conquest:
1st Prize: Suraj Goel, Snigdha Dalvi, Prakhar Agrawal, Saurabh Gupta (IIT Delhi)
2nd Prize: Khayati Mittal, Samikshya Chand, Mayank Garg, Parth Shyara (IIT BHU)
3rd Prize: Harshit Goel, Abhay Saxena, Mayuna Gupta, Vivek Singal (IIT Delhi)
Best Freshers: Rahul Kumar, Sangam, G Rahul Kranti Kiran, Rajesh Prajapati (IIT Kharagpur)
Best Algorithm: Diptarghya Santra (NIT Rourkela)
